@blkahn Pemex has a history of corruption. Its decreasing production levels led Mexico to look to bids from private companies. In order to adapt to losing its monopoly on Mexico's rich underwater oil fields Pemex has partnered with private companies, e.g., Chevron and Japan‚Äôs Inpex.

@SDonziger #Chevron's decade-long persecution of #Donziger is complicated, but here's a place to start. He won a landmark pollution case against the oil giant for polluting the rainforest in #Ecuador -- and the oil giant retaliated. @SDonziger https://t.co/yJwLvVMfoe

@scs_real I wouldn't call Mexico "Socialist" Their oil was nationalized in the '30s and sales have been state run. But even that began to change in 2018. Now gas stations there are Chevron and BP instead of Pemex. 

Also retail prices are 1/2 or less what we pay.

Texaco, Inc. ("The Texas Company") is an American oil brand of the Chevron Corporation. Its flagship product is its fuel "Texaco with Techron". In 1905, it established an operation in Antwerp, Belgium, under the name Continental Petroleum Company, which it acquired control of
